lectures.description: This lecture introduces the fundamental concepts of statistics as they apply to data science, covering topics like different types of data, how to understand and classify data, and various scales of measurement. It lays the groundwork for the course by providing an essential understanding of data characteristics.
lectures.title: Statistics for Data Science 1 - Introduction

lectures.description: This introduction provides an overview of the course structure, breaking down the content into manageable weekly segments. This will help you understand the flow of learning and how each lecture contributes to the overall understanding of statistics in data science.
lectures.title: Introduction - Week wise of  the course

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the basics of data, defining different types of data and exploring key concepts. It provides a solid foundation for understanding the various forms of information that data scientists work with.
lectures.title: Lecture 1.1 - Introduction and Types of Data - Basic definitions

lectures.description: Building upon the introduction to data types, this lecture focuses on gaining a deeper understanding of the characteristics and nuances of data. It explores how to interpret and extract meaningful insights from various data sources.
lectures.title: Lecture 1.2 - Introduction and Types of Data - Understanding data

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the classification of data, organizing different types of data based on their properties and characteristics. This knowledge is crucial for understanding how to appropriately analyze and interpret different types of data.
lectures.title: Lecture 1.3 -  Introduction and Types of Data - Classification of data

lectures.description: This lecture explores the different scales of measurement, providing a framework for understanding the level of precision and information contained within different types of data. This knowledge is essential for selecting appropriate statistical techniques and ensuring accurate analysis.
lectures.title: Lecture 1.4 - Introduction and Types of Data - Scales of measurement

lectures.description: This tutorial provides hands-on practice with the concepts covered in the previous lectures. It will solidify your understanding of data types, classification, and scales of measurement.
lectures.title: Tutorial 1 - Statistics for Data Science 1

lectures.description: This tutorial provides further practice with the concepts discussed in the preceding lectures, reinforcing your understanding of data analysis and manipulation.
lectures.title: Tutorial 2 - Statistics for Data Science 1

lectures.description: This tutorial focuses on mastering spreadsheet formulae, providing essential tools for data manipulation and analysis. It covers common functions and techniques used in spreadsheet programs like Microsoft Excel or Google Sheets.
lectures.title: Tutorial 3 - Spreadsheet formulae

lectures.description: This tutorial guides you through the process of downloading and uploading spreadsheets, ensuring you can effectively manage and access data files. It covers common techniques and best practices for working with data in spreadsheet applications.
lectures.title: Tutorial 4 - Downloading and Uploading spreadsheets

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the techniques of describing categorical data, focusing on the concept of frequency distributions. It introduces methods for summarizing and visualizing categorical data, which is essential for understanding the patterns and trends within different categories.
lectures.title: Lecture 2.1 - Describing Categorical Data - Frequency distributions

lectures.description: This lecture explores the use of charts for representing and interpreting categorical data. It discusses various chart types and their effectiveness in conveying different aspects of the data, providing tools for visual analysis and communication.
lectures.title: Lecture 2.2 - Describing Categorical Data - Charts of categorical data

lectures.description: This lecture dives into the best practices for creating effective and informative charts of categorical data. It covers principles for selecting appropriate chart types, incorporating clear labels and legends, and avoiding misleading representations.
lectures.title: Lecture 2.3 - Describing Categorical Data - Best practices while graphing data - 1

lectures.description: Continuing the discussion on best practices for visualizing categorical data, this lecture provides further guidelines for creating accurate and insightful charts. It emphasizes the importance of avoiding misleading interpretations and presenting data in a clear and easily understandable manner.
lectures.title: Lecture 2.4 - Describing Categorical Data - Best practices while graphing data - 2

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the measures of central tendency for categorical data, specifically focusing on the mode and median. It explains how these measures can provide insights into the distribution and typical values within a dataset.
lectures.title: Lecture 2.5 - Describing Categorical Data - Mode and Median

lectures.description: This tutorial provides practical exercises on creating charts and tables based on the concepts discussed in the previous lectures. It reinforces your understanding of data visualization and analysis.
lectures.title: week 2 - Tutorial - 1 Problems Charts and Tables

lectures.description: This tutorial focuses on identifying and analyzing misleading graphs, equipping you with the skills to critically evaluate and interpret data representations. It emphasizes the importance of accurate and ethical data presentation.
lectures.title: week 2  - Tutorial - 2 Problems Misleading Graphs

lectures.description: This tutorial explores the SUMIF function in Google Sheets, providing a powerful tool for conditional summing of data. It demonstrates practical applications of this function for analyzing and manipulating data.
lectures.title: week 2  - Tutorial - 3  SUMIF in Google Sheets

lectures.description: This tutorial introduces the VLOOKUP function in Google Sheets, offering a versatile tool for retrieving data based on specific criteria. It covers various applications of this function for data analysis and manipulation.
lectures.title: week 2 - Tutorial - 4 VLOOKUP in Google Sheets

lectures.description: This video provides solutions to practice problems related to the concepts covered in Week 2, reinforcing your understanding of data analysis and visualization techniques.
lectures.title: Wk 2 Practice Solution Video

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the methods for describing numerical data, specifically focusing on frequency tables. It provides a structured approach for summarizing and visualizing numerical data, revealing patterns and distributions.
lectures.title: Lecture 3.1 - Describing Numerical Data - Frequency Tables for numerical data

lectures.description: This lecture explores the concept of the mean, a fundamental measure of central tendency for numerical data. It explains how to calculate the mean and its implications for understanding the average value within a dataset.
lectures.title: Lecture 3.2  - Describing Numerical Data - Mean

lectures.description: This lecture continues the discussion of central tendency for numerical data, covering the median and mode. It explains the differences between these measures and their applications in data analysis.
lectures.title: Lecture 3.3 - Describing Numerical Data - Median and Mode

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the concept of measures of dispersion, focusing on the range. It explains how the range can be used to understand the spread and variability of data within a dataset.
lectures.title: Lecture 3.4 - Describing Numerical Data - Measures of dispersion- Range

lectures.description: This lecture explores important concepts like percentiles, quartiles, and the interquartile range. These measures provide valuable insights into the distribution of data and the location of specific values within a dataset.
lectures.title: Lecture 3.5 - Describing Numerical Data - Percentiles, Quartiles, and Interquartile range

lectures.description: This tutorial provides hands-on exercises and practice problems related to the concepts covered in Week 3. It reinforces your understanding of describing and summarizing numerical data.
lectures.title: Week 3 - Tutorial 1

lectures.description: This tutorial provides further practice with the concepts discussed in Week 3, deepening your understanding of data analysis and interpretation.
lectures.title: Week 3 - Tutorial 2

lectures.description: This tutorial delves into practical applications of the concepts covered in Week 3, providing real-world examples and scenarios.
lectures.title: Week 3 - Tutorial 3

lectures.description: This tutorial focuses on specific techniques and tools for analyzing numerical data, providing a deeper understanding of data manipulation and interpretation.
lectures.title: Week 3 - Tutorial 4

lectures.description: This tutorial offers additional practice and exercises related to the concepts covered in Week 3, reinforcing your understanding of numerical data analysis.
lectures.title: Week 3 - Tutorial 5

lectures.description: This tutorial explores advanced concepts and applications related to the concepts covered in Week 3, expanding your knowledge base.
lectures.title: Week 3 - Tutorial 6

lectures.description: This tutorial focuses on specific tools and techniques for analyzing numerical data, providing practical insights and applications.
lectures.title: Week 3 - Tutorial 7

lectures.description: This tutorial focuses on creating box plots, a valuable visualization tool for summarizing and comparing numerical data. It provides hands-on practice in constructing and interpreting box plots.
lectures.title: Week 3 - Box plot Tutorial

lectures.description: This video provides a comprehensive overview of the concepts and practices covered in Week 3, serving as a final review and summary.
lectures.title: W3PFinalVideo

lectures.description: This graded assignment tests your understanding of the concepts covered in Week 3, providing an opportunity to apply your knowledge and receive feedback on your progress.
lectures.title: Week 3 - Graded Assignment Solution

lectures.description: This lecture revisits key concepts from the course, providing a comprehensive review of the material covered so far. It serves as a foundation for understanding the upcoming concepts related to association between variables.
lectures.title: Lecture 4.1 - Association between two variables - Review of course

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the concept of association between two categorical variables, laying the groundwork for understanding relationships between different groups or categories within data.
lectures.title: Lecture 4.2 - Association between two categorical variables - Introduction

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the calculation and interpretation of relative frequencies, providing a method for understanding the strength of association between two categorical variables. It helps quantify the relationships between different groups.
lectures.title: Lecture 4.3 - Association between two categorical variables - Relative frequencies

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the scatterplot, a powerful visual tool for exploring the relationship between two numerical variables. It demonstrates how to create and interpret scatterplots to identify potential patterns and trends.
lectures.title: Lecture 4.4 - Association between two numerical variables - Scatterplot

lectures.description: This lecture focuses on describing the association between two numerical variables, covering key concepts like direction (positive, negative), strength (weak, moderate, strong), and form (linear, nonlinear). It provides a framework for characterizing relationships between numerical data.
lectures.title: Lecture 4.5 - Association between two numerical variables - Describing association

lectures.description: This lecture explores the concept of covariance, a measure of how two numerical variables change together. It explains how to calculate covariance and its implications for understanding the relationship between variables.
lectures.title: Lecture 4.6 - Association between two numerical variables - Covariance

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the concept of correlation, a standardized measure of the linear association between two numerical variables. It covers the calculation and interpretation of correlation coefficients, providing insights into the strength and direction of relationships.
lectures.title: Lecture 4.7 - Association between two numerical variables - Correlation

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the process of fitting a line to a set of data points, exploring methods for finding the best-fitting line and using it to predict values of one variable based on another. This provides tools for modeling and understanding relationships.
lectures.title: Lecture 4.8  - Association between two numerical variables - Fitting a line

lectures.description: This lecture examines the association between categorical and numerical variables, exploring techniques for analyzing relationships between different types of data. It provides insights into how to interpret and understand these complex relationships.
lectures.title: Lecture 4.9 - Association between categorical and numerical variables

lectures.description: This tutorial provides practice exercises and problems related to the concepts covered in Week 4, focusing on understanding and analyzing the association between variables.
lectures.title: Week  4 - Tutorial 1

lectures.description: This tutorial delves deeper into the concepts covered in Week 4, providing additional practice and real-world examples of analyzing relationships between variables.
lectures.title: Week 4 - Tutorial 2

lectures.description: This tutorial focuses on specific techniques and tools for analyzing the association between variables, providing hands-on experience with data manipulation and interpretation.
lectures.title: Week 4 - Tutorial 3

lectures.description: This tutorial offers further practice and exercises related to the concepts covered in Week 4, reinforcing your understanding of analyzing relationships between different types of data.
lectures.title: Week 4 - Tutorial 4

lectures.description: This session provides solutions to practice assignments related to the concepts covered in Week 4, offering insights and clarifications on the problem-solving process.
lectures.title: Week4 - Practice Assignment Solutions

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the fundamental principles of counting, laying the groundwork for understanding permutations and combinations. It covers basic concepts and techniques used in counting different arrangements.
lectures.title: Lecture 5.1 - Permutations and Combinations - Basic Principles of counting

lectures.description: This lecture explores the concept of factorials, a fundamental tool in calculating permutations and combinations. It explains the definition and properties of factorials, demonstrating their application in counting problems.
lectures.title: Lecture 5.2 - Permutations and Combinations - Factorials

lectures.description: This lecture focuses on permutations involving distinct objects, providing a method for calculating the number of possible arrangements of objects when all objects are different. It covers the formulas and techniques for calculating permutations.
lectures.title: Lecture 5.3 - Permutations and Combinations - Permutations: Distinct objects

lectures.description: This lecture explores permutations involving objects that are not distinct, where some objects may be identical. It covers the formulas and techniques for calculating permutations when objects are not all unique.
lectures.title: Lecture 5.4 - Permutations and Combinations - Permutations : Objects not distinct

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the concept of combinations, providing a method for calculating the number of ways to select a group of items from a larger set without regard to order. It explains the formulas and techniques for calculating combinations.
lectures.title: Lecture 5.5 - Permutations and Combinations - Combinations

lectures.description: This lecture explores various real-world applications of permutations and combinations, demonstrating how these concepts can be used to solve problems in diverse fields like probability, statistics, and computer science.
lectures.title: Lecture 5.6 - Permutations and Combinations - Applications

lectures.description: This tutorial provides practical exercises and problems related to the concepts covered in Week 5, focusing on applying permutations and combinations to solve real-world scenarios.
lectures.title: week 5 Tutorial 1

lectures.description: This tutorial provides further practice with the concepts discussed in Week 5, deepening your understanding of permutations, combinations, and their applications.
lectures.title: week 5 Tutorial 2

lectures.description: This tutorial delves into specific techniques and tools for solving permutation and combination problems, providing hands-on experience with data manipulation and interpretation.
lectures.title: week 5 Tutorial 3

lectures.description: This tutorial offers additional practice and exercises related to the concepts covered in Week 5, reinforcing your understanding of permutation and combination problems.
lectures.title: week 5 Tutorial 4

lectures.description: This tutorial explores advanced concepts and applications related to the concepts covered in Week 5, expanding your knowledge base.
lectures.title: week 5 Tutorial 5

lectures.description: This tutorial focuses on specific tools and techniques for solving permutation and combination problems, providing practical insights and applications.
lectures.title: week 5 Tutorial 6

lectures.title: Week 5 - Practice Assignment Solutions

lectures.description: This graded assignment tests your understanding of the concepts covered in Week 5, providing an opportunity to apply your knowledge and receive feedback on your progress.

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the fundamental concepts of probability, defining key terms and providing a foundational understanding of the field. It lays the groundwork for understanding the principles of probability theory.
lectures.title: Lecture 6.1 - Probability - Basic Definitions

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the concept of events in probability, covering the basic operations that can be performed on events such as union, intersection, and complement. It provides tools for manipulating and analyzing events within the context of probability.
lectures.title: Lecture 6.2 - Probability - Events and basic operations on events

lectures.description: This lecture explores the concept of a random experiment, introducing the idea of sample space and events. It provides a framework for understanding the fundamental components of probability theory.
lectures.title: Lecture 6.3 - Probability - Random experiment, Same Space events

lectures.description: This lecture discusses the essential properties of probability, providing a set of rules and axioms that govern the behavior of probabilities. It lays the foundation for understanding how probabilities are calculated and interpreted.
lectures.title: Lecture 6.4 - Probability - Properties of probability

lectures.description: This lecture focuses on calculating probabilities in situations where all outcomes are equally likely. It introduces the concept of equally likely outcomes and demonstrates how to calculate probabilities in these scenarios.
lectures.title: Lecture 6.5 - Probability - Equally likely outcomes

lectures.description: This lecture explores further applications of calculating probabilities in scenarios with equally likely outcomes, providing additional examples and problem-solving techniques.
lectures.title: Lecture 6.6 - Probability - Equally likely outcomes

lectures.description: This tutorial provides hands-on exercises and practice problems related to the concepts covered in Week 6, focusing on applying probability principles to solve real-world scenarios.
lectures.title: week 6 - Tutorial 1

lectures.description: This tutorial provides further practice with the concepts discussed in Week 6, deepening your understanding of probability theory and its applications.
lectures.title: week 6 - Tutorial 2

lectures.description: This tutorial delves into specific techniques and tools for solving probability problems, providing hands-on experience with data manipulation and interpretation.
lectures.title: week 6 - Tutorial 3

lectures.description: This tutorial offers additional practice and exercises related to the concepts covered in Week 6, reinforcing your understanding of probability problems.
lectures.title: week 6 - Tutorial 4

lectures.description: This tutorial explores advanced concepts and applications related to the concepts covered in Week 6, expanding your knowledge base.
lectures.title: week 6  - Tutorial 5

lectures.description: This tutorial focuses on specific tools and techniques for solving probability problems, providing practical insights and applications.
lectures.title: week 6 - Tutorial 6

lectures.description: This tutorial provides additional practice and exercises related to the concepts covered in Week 6, reinforcing your understanding of probability problems.

lectures.description: This graded assignment tests your understanding of the concepts covered in Week 6, providing an opportunity to apply your knowledge and receive feedback on your progress.
lectures.title: Week 6 - Graded Assignment Solutions

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the concept of conditional probability, providing a framework for understanding how probabilities change based on new information or evidence. It covers contingency tables, a tool for visualizing and analyzing conditional probabilities.
lectures.title: Lecture 7.1 - Conditional Probability - contingency tables

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the formula for calculating conditional probabilities, explaining how to determine the probability of an event occurring given that another event has already occurred. It provides a practical approach for calculating conditional probabilities.
lectures.title: Lecture 7.2 - Conditional Probability - Conditional probability formula

lectures.description: This lecture explores the multiplication rule, a fundamental principle in probability that relates the probability of multiple events occurring. It provides tools for calculating the probability of complex events involving multiple outcomes.
lectures.title: Lecture 7.3 - Conditional Probability - Multiplication rule

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the concept of independent events, where the occurrence of one event does not affect the probability of another event. It explains how to identify and analyze independent events in probability.
lectures.title: Lecture 7.4 -  Conditional Probability - Independent events

lectures.description: This lecture provides real-world examples of independent events, illustrating how to apply the concept in different contexts. It demonstrates the application of the principles of independent events in practical scenarios.
lectures.title: lecture 7.5 -  Conditional Probability - Independent events: examples

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the properties of independent events, providing a set of rules and axioms that govern their behavior. It reinforces the understanding of independent events and their implications.
lectures.title: Lecture 7.6 -  Conditional Probability - Independent events: properties

lectures.description: This lecture introduces Bayes' rule, a powerful theorem for updating probabilities based on new evidence. It provides a method for revising prior beliefs and incorporating new information to obtain more accurate probabilities.
lectures.title: Lecture 7.7 -  Conditional Probability - Bayes' rule

lectures.description: This tutorial provides hands-on exercises and practice problems related to the concepts covered in Week 7, focusing on applying conditional probability principles to solve real-world scenarios.
lectures.title: week 7 Tutorial 1

lectures.description: This tutorial provides further practice with the concepts discussed in Week 7, deepening your understanding of conditional probability and its applications.
lectures.title: week 7 Tutorial 2

lectures.description: This tutorial delves into specific techniques and tools for solving conditional probability problems, providing hands-on experience with data manipulation and interpretation.
lectures.title: week 7 Tutorial 3

lectures.description: This tutorial offers additional practice and exercises related to the concepts covered in Week 7, reinforcing your understanding of conditional probability problems.
lectures.title: week 7 Tutorial 4

lectures.description: This tutorial explores advanced concepts and applications related to the concepts covered in Week 7, expanding your knowledge base.
lectures.title: week 7 Tutorial 5

lectures.description: This tutorial focuses on specific tools and techniques for solving conditional probability problems, providing practical insights and applications.
lectures.title: week 7 Tutorial 6

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the concept of random variables, providing a foundational understanding of variables that take on numerical values based on random outcomes. It lays the groundwork for understanding the behavior of random variables.
lectures.title: Lecture 8.1 - Random variables  - Introduction

lectures.description: This lecture explores real-world applications of random variables, demonstrating how they are used to model and analyze random phenomena. It provides practical examples of random variables in different contexts.
lectures.title: Lecture 8.2 - Random variables - Application

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the classification of random variables, distinguishing between discrete and continuous random variables. It explains the key differences and characteristics of each type of random variable.
lectures.title: Lecture 8.3 - Random variables - Discrete and continuous random variable

lectures.description: This lecture focuses on the probability mass function (PMF) for discrete random variables, explaining its properties and how it represents the probability distribution of a discrete random variable. It provides tools for analyzing and understanding the distribution of discrete variables.
lectures.title: Lecture 8.4 - Discrete random variables - Probability mass function properties

lectures.description: This lecture explores the graphical representation of probability mass functions, demonstrating how to visualize the distribution of discrete random variables. It provides insights into the patterns and characteristics of discrete distributions.
lectures.title: Lecture 8.5 - Discrete random variables - Graph of probability mass function

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the cumulative distribution function (CDF) for discrete random variables, explaining its properties and how it represents the probability of a random variable taking on a value less than or equal to a given value. It provides tools for analyzing and understanding the cumulative distribution of discrete variables.
lectures.title: Lecture 8.6 - Discrete random variables - Cumulative distribution function

lectures.description: This tutorial provides hands-on exercises and practice problems related to the concepts covered in Week 8, focusing on applying the concepts of random variables and probability distributions to real-world scenarios.
lectures.title: Week 8  - Tutorial 1

lectures.description: This tutorial provides further practice with the concepts discussed in Week 8, deepening your understanding of random variables, probability distributions, and their applications.
lectures.title: Week 8  - Tutorial 2

lectures.description: This tutorial delves into specific techniques and tools for analyzing random variables and their distributions, providing hands-on experience with data manipulation and interpretation.
lectures.title: Week 8  - Tutorial 3

lectures.description: This tutorial offers additional practice and exercises related to the concepts covered in Week 8, reinforcing your understanding of random variables and their distributions.
lectures.title: Week 8 - Tutorial 4

lectures.description: This tutorial explores advanced concepts and applications related to the concepts covered in Week 8, expanding your knowledge base.
lectures.title: Week 8 - Tutorial 5

lectures.description: This tutorial focuses on specific tools and techniques for analyzing random variables and their distributions, providing practical insights and applications.
lectures.title: Week 8 - Tutorial 6

lectures.description: This tutorial provides a deeper understanding of infinite series, a mathematical concept that is often used in probability and statistics. It explores the properties and applications of infinite series in the context of random variables and probability distributions.
lectures.title: Infinite Series Tutorial

lectures.description: This lecture provides real-world examples of discrete random variables, demonstrating their application in different contexts. It showcases how discrete random variables are used to model and analyze random phenomena.
lectures.title: Lecture 9.1 - Discrete random variable - Application

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the concept of expectation, a fundamental measure of the average value of a random variable. It explains how to calculate the expectation and its implications for understanding the central tendency of a random variable.
lectures.title: Lecture 9.2 - Expectation of a random variable

lectures.description: This lecture explores the properties of expectation, providing a set of rules and axioms that govern its behavior. It reinforces the understanding of expectation and its applications.
lectures.title: Lecture 9.3 - Expectation of a random variable - Properties of expectation

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the concept of variance, a measure of the spread or variability of a random variable. It explains how to calculate variance and its implications for understanding the dispersion of a random variable.
lectures.title: Lecture 9.4 - Variance of a random variable - Properties of variance

lectures.description: This lecture explores the properties of variance, providing a set of rules and axioms that govern its behavior. It reinforces the understanding of variance and its applications.
lectures.title: Lecture 9.5 - Variance of a random variable - Properties of variance

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the concept of standard deviation, a measure of the spread or variability of a random variable, closely related to variance. It explains how to calculate standard deviation and its implications for understanding the dispersion of a random variable.
lectures.title: Lecture 9.6 - Standard deviation of a random variable

lectures.description: This session provides solutions to practice assignments related to the concepts covered in Week 9, offering insights and clarifications on the problem-solving process.
lectures.title: week 9 - Practice Assignment Solutions

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the binomial distribution, a fundamental discrete probability distribution used to model the probability of successes in a fixed number of independent trials. It covers the Bernoulli distribution, a special case of the binomial distribution, and lays the groundwork for understanding binomial probabilities.
lectures.title: Lecture 10.1 - Binomial distribution - Bernoulli distribution

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the concept of independent and identically distributed (IID) Bernoulli trials, a key assumption underlying the binomial distribution. It explains the characteristics of IID trials and how they contribute to the structure of the binomial distribution.
lectures.title: Lecture 10.2 - Binomial distribution - IID Bernoulli trials

lectures.description: This lecture explores the distribution of the binomial random variable, providing a detailed explanation of the probability mass function and its properties. It covers the calculation of binomial probabilities and the interpretation of the binomial distribution.
lectures.title: Lecture 10.3 - Binomial distribution - Distribution of Binomial random variable

lectures.description: This lecture demonstrates how to model real-world situations using the binomial distribution, providing examples and scenarios where the binomial distribution is appropriate. It highlights the applicability of the binomial distribution in various fields.
lectures.title: Lecture 10.4 - Binomial distribution - Modeling situations as Binomial distribution

lectures.description: This lecture explores the expectation and variance of the binomial random variable, providing formulas and explanations for calculating these key measures of central tendency and dispersion. It deepens the understanding of the properties of the binomial distribution.
lectures.title: Lecture 10.5 - Binomial distribution - Expectation and variance of Binomial random variable

lectures.description: This tutorial provides hands-on exercises and practice problems related to the concepts covered in Week 10, focusing on applying the binomial distribution to solve real-world scenarios.
lectures.title: week 10  - Tutorial 1

lectures.description: This tutorial provides further practice with the concepts discussed in Week 10, deepening your understanding of the binomial distribution and its applications.

lectures.description: This lecture explores the hypergeometric distribution, a discrete probability distribution used to model the probability of successes in a sample drawn without replacement from a finite population. It covers the calculation of hypergeometric probabilities and the interpretation of the hypergeometric distribution.
lectures.title: week 9 - Expectation of Hypergeometric Random Variable

lectures.description: This tutorial provides a deep dive into the concept of outliers, their identification, and their impact on statistical analysis. It explores various methods for detecting outliers and techniques for handling them appropriately.
lectures.title: Outliers tutorial

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the uniform distribution, a continuous probability distribution where all values within a specified range are equally likely. It covers the properties and applications of the uniform distribution in different contexts.
lectures.title: Continuous random variable - Uniform distribution

lectures.description: This lecture explores real-world applications of the uniform distribution, demonstrating its use in modeling and analyzing continuous random phenomena. It provides practical examples of the uniform distribution in various fields.
lectures.title: Continuous random variable - Uniform distribution: applications

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the concept of non-uniform and triangular distributions, providing a deeper understanding of continuous probability distributions that deviate from the uniform model. It explores the characteristics and applications of these distributions.
lectures.title: Continuous random variable - Non uniform and triangular distribution

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the exponential distribution, a continuous probability distribution used to model the time between events or the duration of events. It covers the properties and applications of the exponential distribution in different contexts.
lectures.title: Continuous random variable - Exponential distribution

lectures.description: This lecture provides an overview of continuous random variables, explaining their key characteristics and contrasting them with discrete random variables. It lays the groundwork for understanding the concepts of continuous probability distributions.
lectures.title: Continuous random variable - Introduction

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the normal distribution, one of the most important and widely used continuous probability distributions. It covers the properties and characteristics of the normal distribution, explaining its significance in statistics and data analysis.
lectures.title: Normal Distribution

lectures.description: This lecture focuses on the standard normal distribution, a special case of the normal distribution with a mean of 0 and a standard deviation of 1. It explains the properties and applications of the standard normal distribution, demonstrating its role in standardizing and comparing normal distributions.
lectures.title: Standard Normal Distribution

lectures.description: This lecture explores the process of standardizing a normal random variable, transforming it into a standard normal variable. It explains the techniques for standardization and demonstrates its usefulness in comparing and analyzing normal distributions.
lectures.title: Standardizing a normal random variable

lectures.description: This lecture delves into the additive property of normal distributions and the concept of percentiles. It explains how to calculate probabilities and percentiles for normal distributions, providing tools for analyzing and interpreting normal data.
lectures.title: Additive Property and percentiles

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the hypergeometric distribution, a discrete probability distribution used to model the probability of successes in a sample drawn without replacement from a finite population. It covers the calculation of hypergeometric probabilities and the interpretation of the hypergeometric distribution.
lectures.title: Hypergeometric Distribution

lectures.description: This lecture explores the expectation and variance of the hypergeometric distribution, providing formulas and explanations for calculating these key measures of central tendency and dispersion. It deepens the understanding of the properties of the hypergeometric distribution.
lectures.title: Expectation and variance of  Hypergeometric Distribution

lectures.description: This lecture introduces the Poisson distribution, a discrete probability distribution used to model the probability of events occurring in a fixed interval of time or space. It covers the calculation of Poisson probabilities and the interpretation of the Poisson distribution.
lectures.title: Poisson Distribution

lectures.description: This lecture explores the expectation and variance of the Poisson distribution, providing formulas and explanations for calculating these key measures of central tendency and dispersion. It deepens the understanding of the properties of the Poisson distribution.
lectures.title: Expectation and variance of Poisson Distribution

course.name: Statistics for Data Science
course.overview: This course delves into the core principles of statistics, equipping you with the essential knowledge and skills to effectively analyze and interpret data in the context of data science. From understanding different types of data to calculating probabilities and interpreting distributions, this course provides a comprehensive foundation for applying statistical methods to real-world data analysis problems.
